items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today Wednesday 26 November 2025 and for the next few days. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . Slow drainage of the Broads means rivers may remain high into the weekend 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Darlington, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 27 November 2025 . 
Flooding is possible from 03:45am to 1:00pm on 27/11/2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, in particular Middleton in Teesdale and Barnard Castle. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 26 November 2025 and into Thursday, 27 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 26 November 2025 and into Thursday, 27 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly around the Low Marishes and Malton area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 26 November 2025 from 6:15PM till the morning of 27th November 2026. 
This is only for the Dragley Beck area as no other river responses are expected. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. Levels are now peaking and expected to drop over the coming days. Flooding is expected on Wednesday, 26 November 2025 and into Thursday, 27 November 2025. Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 08:00AM on 27 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
